verses.text: In the year that Tartan came unto **Ashdod** (when **Sargon,** the king of **Assyria,** sent **him),** and fought against Ashdod, and took **it,**

At the same time spake the **Lord** by **Isaiah,** the son of Amoz, saying, **Go,** and loose the sackcloth from off thy loins, and put off thy shoe from thy foot. And he did so, walking naked and barefoot.
And the **Lord** said, Like as my servant Isaiah hath walked naked and barefoot three years for a sign and wonder upon Egypt and upon **Ethiopia,**
So shall the king of Assyria lead away the Egyptians **prisoners** and the Ethiopians captives, young and old, naked and barefoot, even with their buttocks uncovered, to the shame of Egypt.
And they shall be afraid and ashamed of **Ethiopia,** their expectation, and of **Egypt,** their glory.
And the inhabitant of this isle shall say in that day, Behold, such is our **expectationâ€”whither** we flee for help to be delivered from the king of **Assyria. And** how shall we escape?
